quote: The start was fast and felt great. About 26 miles in, the head winds seemed to be everywhere you turned. Riding solo at that point made it hard. Beautiful farm country though, and it felt great to finish feeling good but worn out at the same time.
Beth and I were the only women in the 60+, but we came in ahead of the 50-59 and one of the 40-49, so we felt legit on the podium!

This year I chased Tracy for the first mile until, just as on Zwift, she vanished with the pack! Although, in my defense, she did utilize the tactic of wearing me out on our warmup beforehand. üòÅ She's a clever one and so fast!
I loved the course, fast, no chunky gravel and no giant hills! I was happy to improve my time at the distance and even got a taste of what it's like to climb up on the wooden box at the end!
The post-race hangout, and great local food made the finish line feel like a festival

This race isn't just about watts and finish times‚Äîit's about sharing the day with other riders who love gravel as much as we do. The post-race hangout, and great local food made the finish line feel like a festival, and that's the kind of energy we love to see in cycling!
The Cedar Blitz has quickly become a must-do event in the regional gravel scene
The BaseCamp community has given me so many cycling friends from across the country. Beth came up from Kansas!
